sections.heading: Overview
sections.prompt: Write a brief overview of doc_evergreen as a CLI tool for AI-powered documentation generation. Explain that it uses templates to define documentation structure and regenerates docs as code evolves. Mention key features: template-based generation, change preview, iterative refinement, progress feedback. Keep it concise (2-3 paragraphs).

sections.heading: Installation
sections.prompt: Provide installation instructions for doc_evergreen. Include: (1) Python version requirement, (2) Installation command using uv or pip, (3) Verification command to confirm installation. Keep it simple and beginner-friendly.

sections.heading: Quick Start
sections.prompt: Create a 5-minute quick start guide. Include: (1) Creating your first template, (2) Running regen-doc command, (3) Reviewing and approving changes. Provide complete working examples that users can copy and run. Focus on getting users productive quickly.

sections.heading: Commands
sections.prompt: Document all CLI commands available in doc_evergreen. For each command, provide: (1) Command name and syntax, (2) Purpose and use case, (3) All available options/flags, (4) Usage examples. Currently there's regen-doc - document it comprehensively.

sections.heading: Template Structure
sections.prompt: Explain the JSON template structure in detail. Cover all fields (title, output, sections with heading/prompt/sources). Show the complete schema with data types and requirements. Include examples of both simple and nested templates.

sections.heading: Source Specification
sections.prompt: Explain how to specify source files in templates. Cover: (1) Glob patterns and syntax, (2) Relative path resolution, (3) Per-section sources, (4) Best practices for choosing sources. Include many examples showing different patterns (specific files, wildcards, recursive patterns).

sections.heading: Workflows
sections.prompt: Document common workflows and usage patterns. Include: (1) Initial documentation generation, (2) Updating docs as code changes, (3) Iterative refinement process, (4) CI/CD integration with --auto-approve, (5) Working with multiple templates. Provide step-by-step guides for each workflow.

sections.heading: Progress Feedback
sections.prompt: Explain the real-time progress feedback system. Describe what information is shown during generation: section progress ([1/2]), source files used, timing information, completion markers. Show example output so users know what to expect.

sections.heading: Troubleshooting
sections.prompt: Create a troubleshooting guide for common issues. For each issue, provide: (1) Symptoms, (2) Likely causes, (3) Step-by-step solutions. Cover issues like: template parsing errors, source files not found, no changes detected, permission errors, glob patterns not matching. Use the troubleshooting section from TEMPLATES.md as a starting point and expand it.

sections.heading: Best Practices
sections.prompt: Provide best practices for using doc_evergreen effectively. Cover: (1) Writing effective prompts (specific, actionable, scoped), (2) Organizing templates and outputs, (3) Source file selection strategy, (4) Section structure design, (5) Maintaining templates over time. Include do's and don'ts with examples.
